object.name: COSMOS 1500 Satellite details 1983-099A NORAD 14372
object.information: The Cosmos 1500 spacecraft was a precursor to the operational Russian Okean ("Ocean") series of oceanographic remote sensing missions. The satellite tested a new sensors and methods of data collection and processing. Cosmos 1500 had the capability of overlapping and processing images from its sensors. Data from satellite were sent directly to ships or automated data receiving stations and was applied in navigation in northern oceans.

link.title: This article uses material from AFSPC
